author: tobrien
title: No-Code For Creative Africa
description: Lack of a Pan-Africa strategy to gain a piece of the 4.07 trillion IT service Market or to meets its growing IT needs.

assessments.note: Reducing the knowledge threshold to build apps onto Cardano would increase the probability of take up across Africa.

A very innovative idea to empower african citizen developers. This proposal will be incredibly effective if successfully implemented and have transformative potential by combining the potential enable new people to produce and integrate applications, giving the African continent business opportunities that even the EPAs can't interfere with and gravely forward the cardano project.

No-Code development has a very low entry barrier and high return for most of the software development requirements. Training people in the target region in no-code development in blockchain will provide a substantial boost to the availability of developers from Africa thereby fueling the adoption of Cardano.

The proposal for no-code could be applied to other regions as well, but it fits well in to the Africa challenge. If successful it could seed widespread interest in Cardano, and facilitate the development of localized smart contract products which would go on to increase adoption.

assessments.note: The proposal is very detailed and provides a lot of background information on the software and technology used. Milestones and success metrics are set, attainable and auditable.

The progress is quantifiable. The proposal aims to train 1000 persons in writhing smart contracts using Q Modeler in 12 months. with a rate of 20 $ per person to teach Smart contracts. This is measurable and auditable.

The requested budget is not broken down, but clear goals are given for the initial months, and metrics of success given for a 12 month period. While I expect the time frame may be optimistic being that it is reliant on the release of smart contracts, I feel that it will be easy to judge preliminary success in 3-6 months.
